thread.title: UMass talking points: Minutemen 'can't let Bowling Green beat us twice' this week against Kent State
thread.title_full: UMass talking points: Minutemen 'can't let Bowling Green beat us twice' this week against Kent State

author: Daniel Malone | Special to MassLive
title: UMass talking points: Minutemen 'can't let Bowling Green beat us twice' this week against Kent State
text:
Comments 
AMHERST â€“ This week in practice, players talked pretty openly about the disappointment stemming from the University of Massachusetts football team's ugly loss at Bowling Green last game. 
Here's some of what they said about that loss and how they're approaching Saturday's matchup against Kent State . 
Senior center Matt Sparks cut right to the chase, sharing some advice that coaches have preached to players this week: 
"We can't let Bowling Green beat us twice. We've got to move on and keep trusting in each other that we're going to get the job done ... We can't get caught up on mistakes that we made in that game. We've got to move on and look at Kent State and get ready to beat them." 
[ ALSO READ: UMass vs. Kent State: Five keys to the game plus final score prediction ] 
Blake Frohnapfel, who's under more pressure than anyone else when it comes to pulling the Minutemen out of their rut, said players came into the new week upset at themselves: 
"I think for us, guys were kind of pissed off a little bit. We felt disappointed in our execution last game. Guys went out there with a chip on their shoulder because of the way we were playing and the way we were attacking our scout teams. I think that's the way it should be." 
Frohnapfel, most of the time at least, is a happy, upbeat kind of guy. But sometimes even he has to hunker down and get a little angry when things aren't going smoothly: 
"Definitely. It has to be done sometimes. If execution's not there, that's one thing. But if guys aren't giving effort, that's another thing. I think today, with the way they're running around, I think guys are excited to be here and excited for the opportunity this week."
